intro: Orchyllium endresii, commonly known as the Endres' orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Orchyllium endresii is considered a vulnerable species.
